element.name: Geometricache by toczygroszek (adopted by anacreon), Unknown Cache (3/1)

description.p: This is a multi-stage puzzle cache placed in the centre of Dublin and you will have to do some calculations to find the final container. There are few ways to solve this puzzle, it's up to you how to do all the work.

long-description.p:
1st stage of this cache is placed on Trinity College grounds. It may be a good spot to start as you can visit the library or ask students for some maths lessons . Trinity College campus is closed at night time, but the closing time is very late. The Front Gate (N 53° 20.668 W 006° 15.550) is open 7.00 - 0.00 at weekdays and 8.00 - 18.00 at weekends and bank holidays. There is a 2nd gate at Nassau Street (N 53° 20.585 W 006° 15.465) open until midnight at weekends (except Bank Holidays) so you have got nearly all day for visiting that place. More about opening times - click HERE
At the 1st stage at coordinates N 53° 20.628 W 006° 15.355 (call it X) you will see an interesting golden sculpture. You have to find a nearby granite slab with carved description of this sculpture. Note the six digits of dates there and call it ABCD/EF. The distance to the next stage (call it Y) is K meters and direction (azimuth) L degrees from point X, where:
K = (A+F) (C-D) (D+D)
L = D (B-D) E
At stage 2 (point Y) you will see another sculpture and plaque nearby. You have to find a four digit date; call it GHIJ. The next stage (call it Z) is M degrees direction from point X and N degrees direction from point Y, where:
M = (H-I) (G+J) (D+F)
N = (J-G) (D*F*I)
At stage 3 (point Z) you will see one more sculpture and this time you have to find well hidden (by me) information for the final stage. It may be a little bit of searching, you will see why. The information includes three numbers - distance from point X, Y and Z to final cache (Q).
All calculations may include small errors as the degrees do not include decimal places, and final coordinates will accumulate all the errors, but using the hint you should find it without any problems. The final cache is accessible 24/7. The cache contains the logbook and a pencil.

element.additional-waypoints:
FG1NFE7 - Front Gate
N 53° 20.668 W 006° 15.550
NG1NFE7 - Nassau Street Gate
N 53° 20.585 W 006° 15.465
QQ1NFE7 - point Q
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___
YY1NFE7 - point Y
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___
ZZ1NFE7 - point Z
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

ul.li:
2010-06-13T19:00:00Z : Found it by daraconn
Finally found it today. It took me several visits to Stage 3 (Z) to find the well-hidden co-ordinates. Although Stage 3 had caused me much frustration, when I finally found it I was very impressed with the hide.
Two weeks later I got around to going to the final location. I love the way the different locations are united by the same theme. A bit like the "Ancient Symbol" cache, which makes me think the cache owner has a real talent for noticing aspects of the city, that the rest of us just pass by. It takes a lot of thought and work to create a cache like this one.

2010-05-02T19:00:00Z : Found it by olstad
Signed as tsoo together with pstray, enjoyed the mystery.

2010-04-04T19:00:00Z : Found it by Knight&Fox
Phew! What an effort! Not only did our calculations take us directly to the wrong sculpture (where we subsequently spent an hour searching for non-existent information) but, having reworked our answer and finding GZ, we managed to fling the logbook into the unreachable... Eventually retrieved the logbook with no harm done and we were very happy to sign! Very entertaining cache, thank you!
- Knight&Fox

2010-04-02T19:00:00Z : Found it by kallerobs
Really nice and tricky little task, lots of fun included! Stage 1 and 2 were easy to find, Stage 3 really took a while and I almost called the court for human rights [:D], Right before giving up the little nasty beast showed up. Really nice hide, congratulations. Calculations for final only 16m off. Nice cache with lots of walking, in my eyes a bit too far, but perfect for cyclists. TFTC!

wpt.name: GC1NFE7
wpt.desc: Geometricache by toczygroszek (adopted by anacreon), Unknown Cache (3/1)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Geometricache
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: This is a multi-stage puzzle cache placed in the centre of Dublin and you will have to do some calculations to find the final container. There are few ways to solve this puzzle, it's up to you how to do all the work.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
1st stage of this cache is placed on Trinity College grounds. It may be a good spot to start as you can visit the library or ask students for some maths lessons . L = D (B-D) E

All calculations may include small errors as the degrees do not include decimal places, and final coordinates will accumulate all the errors, but using the hint you should find it without any problems. The final cache is accessible 24/7. The cache contains the logbook and a pencil.

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text:
Finally found it today. It took me several visits to Stage 3 (Z) to find the well-hidden co-ordinates. Although Stage 3 had caused me much frustration, when I finally found it I was very impressed with the hide.
Two weeks later I got around to going to the final location. I love the way the different locations are united by the same theme. A bit like the "Ancient Symbol" cache, which makes me think the cache owner has a real talent for noticing aspects of the city, that the rest of us just pass by. It takes a lot of thought and work to create a cache like this one.
Signed as tsoo together with pstray, enjoyed the mystery.

@10:17 #567
One of the best mysterycaches I have solved [:D]. Really liked the theme through the points, and especially the location of the hint on Z [:)]. Thanks for a nice walk around the city and for showing me some parts of Dublin that I probably wouldn't have seen without this cache. Took a few days, but well worth it.

Phew! What an effort! Not only did our calculations take us directly to the wrong sculpture (where we subsequently spent an hour searching for non-existent information) but, having reworked our answer and finding GZ, we managed to fling the logbook into the unreachable... Eventually retrieved the logbook with no harm done and we were very happy to sign! Very entertaining cache, thank you!
- Knight&Fox

Really nice and tricky little task, lots of fun included! Stage 1 and 2 were easy to find, Stage 3 really took a while and I almost called the court for human rights [:D], Right before giving up the little nasty beast showed up. Really nice hide, congratulations. Calculations for final only 16m off. Nice cache with lots of walking, in my eyes a bit too far, but perfect for cyclists. TFTC!
